intro: Morinda gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup's morinda, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when ripe. Morinda gjellerupii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
